trans-unit.source: Wraps an XSD <xref uid="langword_csharp_time" name="time" href=""></xref> type.
For more information about XSD data types, see "XML Data Types Reference" in the MSDN Library at http://msdn.microsoft.com/library.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime"></xref> class with a specified <xref:System.DateTime> object.
A <xref:System.DateTime> object to initialize the current instance.
Returns the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the current SOAP type.
A <xref:System.String> that indicates the XSD of the current SOAP type.
Converts the specified <xref:System.String> into a <xref href="System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime"></xref> object.
The Parse method is capable of parsing strings in the HH:mm:ss.fffzzz format.
This is composed out of the following format patterns.
|Format Pattern|Description|Examples| |--------------------|-----------------|--------------| |HH|The hour within a 24-hour range.
Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|17, 07| |mm|The minute.
Single-digit minutes have a leading zero.|49, 05| |ss|The second.
Single-digit seconds have a leading zero.|32, 02| |fff|The fraction of a second.

A maximum of 7 fraction digits are allowed, and only the first three are parsed.|321635, 4592| |zzz|The full time zone offset (hour and minutes) from the Universal Time Coordinate (Greenwich Mean Time).

Single-digit hours have a leading zero.|-07:00, +08:00, Z| Only the first 3 fraction digits are parsed because the parsed value is stored as a <xref:System.DateTime> object, and the <xref:System.DateTime> type supports precisely 3 fraction digits of accuracy.
The <xref:System.String> to convert.
A object that is obtained from value.
value does not contain a date and time that corresponds to any of the recognized format patterns.
Returns <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime.Value*> as a <xref:System.String>.
A <xref:System.String> that is obtained from <xref:System.Runtime.Remoting.Metadata.W3cXsd2001.SoapTime.Value*> in the format "HH:mm:ss.fffzzz".
Gets or sets the date and time of the current instance.
The <xref:System.DateTime> object that contains the date and time of the current instance.
Gets the XML Schema definition language (XSD) of the current SOAP type.
A <xref:System.String> that indicates the XSD of the current SOAP type.
